definition: to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: The deck force unmoored with veteran ease.
sentences.chinese: 艙面船員動作熟練，輕而易舉地解纜拔錨。

sentences.english: Come on, snap to and make sail. You know how this works.
sentences.chinese: 快點，拔錨起航，你們知道怎麼做的。

sentences.english: On June 4, Allied fleets set off according to the original plan.
sentences.chinese: 六月四日，按照原定計劃，盟軍艦隊拔錨出港。
